meanings.definition: A group or set of twenty.
meanings.sent1: The teacher handed out scores of pencils to the students.
meanings.sent2: There were scores of balloons at the party.
meanings.sent3: The scores of cookies on the plate disappeared in no time.
meanings.sent4: The scores of stars in the sky twinkled brightly.
meanings.sent5: The scores of colorful flowers in the garden created a beautiful display.

meanings.sent1: She had scores of books on her bookshelf.
meanings.sent2: Scores of people attended the concert.
meanings.sent3: The scores of birds chirping outside woke me up early.
meanings.sent4: The scores of leaves falling in autumn painted the ground orange.
meanings.sent5: The scores of waves crashing against the shore sounded soothing.

meanings.definition: To achieve a particular number of points in a game or test.
meanings.sent1: He scores high in every math test.
meanings.sent2: She scores well in basketball games.
meanings.sent3: The cat scores points with its playful antics.
meanings.sent4: The musician scores a perfect ten in the competition.
meanings.sent5: The team scores a winning goal in the final minute.

meanings.definition: To make cuts or lines on a surface.
meanings.sent1: She scores the paper before folding it.
meanings.sent2: He scores the clay to create patterns.
meanings.sent3: The chef scores the cake before icing it.
meanings.sent4: The artist scores the canvas to add texture.
meanings.sent5: The gardener scores the soil for planting seeds.

meanings.definition: To record or keep track of something.
meanings.sent1: She scores all her expenses in a notebook.
meanings.sent2: He scores the progress of the project on a chart.
meanings.sent3: The scientist scores the data meticulously.
meanings.sent4: The referee scores the points during the match.
meanings.sent5: The teacher scores the students' performance in class.
